p: This study set out to determine that Nepal experience semiannual cycle of influenza infection firstly, during the winter month of January–February and secondly, during the month of July–August following rainy season. Despite few cases of influenza B and influenza A(H1N1)pdm09, influenza A/H3 remained predominant throughout the year 2016. This paper argued that the vaccine to be introduced in Nepal must be decided by national authority based on prevailing influenza types.
